intro: Psychotria tapantiensis, commonly known as the Tapanti psychotria, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories, thriving in humid and warm environments. Psychotria tapantiensis is often found in protected areas such as national parks and reserves due to its limited distribution and ecological significance.
